vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Ἅιδης
or ᾅδης, ου, ὁ, Attic dialect; Epic dialect Ἀΐδης, α and ε; Doric dialect Αΐδας, α, used by Trag., in Lyric poetryand anapaest meter: genitive Αϊδος, dative Αϊδι, [Refs 8th c.BC+] only as proper name [Refs 8th c.BC+] —εἰν᾽ Αΐδαο δόμοισι in the nether world, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; frequently εἰν, εἰς Αΐδαο (i.e. δόμοις, δόμους), as [Refs 8th c.BC+]; Trag. and Attic dialect ἐν Ἅιδου, εἰς Ἅιδου (i.e. οἴκῳ, οἶκον), [Refs 5th c.BC+]; Ἄϊδόσδε, adverb to the nether world, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; παρ᾽ Ἅιδῃ, παρ᾽ Ἅιδην, [Refs] —hence,
__2 place of departed spirits, first in [NT+8th c.BC+]
__II after [Refs 8th c.BC+], the grave, death, ἀΐδαν λαγχάνειν, δέξασθαι, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ᾅδης πόντιος death by sea, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ᾅδου πύλη, Astrology texts, region below the Horoscope, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
__II.2 genitive ᾅδου with nouns in adjectival sense, devilish, θύουσαν ᾅ. μητέρ᾽[Refs 5th c.BC+]; fatal, deadly, δίκτυον, ξίφη ᾅ., [Refs 8th c.BC+] in all forms except ᾱῐδος before vowels; ᾱῐδης [Refs 7th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: Hades, the grave, the place of the dead, "the underworld"
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
§ Hades, the grave, the place of the dead, "the underworld"
the invisible abode, or mansion of the dead; the place of punishment, hell; the lowest place or condition, Mt. 11:23; Lk. 10:15
vocabInfos._es_Definition: el Hades, el mundo de los muertos; muerte; tal vez el infierno, el lugar del castigo final
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 陰間(Hades原為陰府神祇的名字,指死者之境)
2) (擬人化的)陰間
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 阴间(Hades原为阴府神祇的名字,指死者之境)
2) (拟人化的)阴间
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: âm phủ; địa ngục ; diêm vương. Α (G1 – không) + εἴδω (G1492)
